page.title: 13RELIGION IN CHIRNSIDE
page.content: The original church in Chirnside was built about 800 years ago. There is still a Norman doorway, now protected by a porch, and inside the building is an inscription dated 1573 _ "Helpe Ye Pur". Also inside the building is a marble relief of Lady Tweedmouth of Hutton Castle. This was gifted by her husband in her memory. To commemorate his death an arched gateway with wrought iron pelicans was built at the entrance to the church. Other famous people buried in the surrounding graveyard include Jim Clark, racing driver, and Henry Erskine, minister at Chirnside in the late 17th century. Many of the gravestones bear emblems of the trades practised by the villagers. Unfortunately the red sandstone of the gravestones has not weathered well and many are now broken.
